alcohol.translation[0].definitions[0].de: drinks such as beer or wine that contain a substance which can make you drunk
alcohol.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: alcohol abuse (=when someone drinks too much)
people with alcohol problems (=people who drink too much)
alcohol.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the chemical substance in alcoholic drinks that can make you drunk, which is also used in other types of products
alcohol.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: alcohol
drinks that contain alcohol  – used especially in rules and warnings about alcoholic drinks
We’re not allowed to serve alcohol to people under 18.
low-alcohol wines (=not containing a lot of alcohol)
He doesn’t drink alcohol or smoke.
alcoholic drinks. Drink is more informal than alcohol
Police officers smelled drink and breath-tested him.
He blamed drink for the violence.
liquor
drinks that contain alcohol, especially strong alcoholic drinks
The man was holding a bottle of liquor in one hand and a cigarette in the other.
a liquor store
He got used to drinking hard liquor  (=strong alcoholic drinks) at an early age.
booze
alcoholic drinks
The doctor told Jimmy to stay off the booze for a while.
He tried to buy booze with a stolen credit card.
spirits
strong alcoholic drinks such as whisky or brandy
We serve a wide range of wines, beers, and spirits.
the hard stuff
strong alcoholic drinks
He enjoyed a drop of the hard stuff (=he liked strong alcoholic drinks).
alcopops
sweet fizzy drinks with alcohol in them
The report showed that alcopops were the most popular drink for 17-year-olds.
